result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward F Hannon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Received and filed:  Original Transcript of Proceedings commencing 8-31-2015 (44 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.
jad

Defendant Edward F Hannon in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Edward F Hannon in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Edward F Hannon not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard on behalf of James Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel has an emergency and is unable to proceed with the plea and sentencing today. Court granted defense request for adjournment. Victim Impact Statement received and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward F Hannon in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Edward F Hannon in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel requested an adjournment to further review the State's offer with the defendant. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Edward F Hannon not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested an adjournment.  Parties were advised that as of  August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G-55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Case is scheduled for plea and sentencing before Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Edward F Hannon not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date; just received discovery.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward F Hannon in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Edward F Hannon in custody.  Ronald Dague for James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with City Hall Square Apartments at 104 E Mason Street, Milwaukee, WI

Defendant Edward F Hannon in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Edward F Hannon in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Edward F Hannon
Current: 7737 W Allerton Ave, Greenfield, WI 53220 United States  (Effective: 06-01-2015)
Prior: 8780 South 6th Street, Oak Creek, WI 53154
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
